thread.title: Bronwyn Bishop issues full apology as she battles to keep her job
thread.title_full: Bronwyn Bishop issues full apology as she battles to keep her job | afr.com

author: Primrose Riordan
title: Bronwyn Bishop issues full apology as she battles to keep her job
text:
Speaker Bronwyn Bishop says: "I have to say I'll be repaying all expenses related to weddings, which while technically in the rules just doesn't look right." On Alan Jones' show on 2GB on Thursday, Mrs Bishop reversed her position, saying she now regretted not apologising earlier and the move to claim expenses for the helicopter ride and a number of colleagues' wedding was an "error or judgement".
"I want to apologise to the Australian people as I feel I have let them down," she said.
As recently as Wednesday Mrs Bishop's office was defending her expenses claims for the weddings of Liberal MP Teresa Gambaro, former MP Sophie Mirabella, saying she also travelled to those locations for confidential parliamentary business.
But on Thursday she said she would now be repaying the funds even though she maintained she believed they were within the rules.
 "With regard to other things, where there's controversy, I have to say I'll be repaying all expenses related to weddings, which while technically in the rules just doesn't look right," she said.
This week some Cabinet ministers have been refusing to back Bronwyn Bishop and in some cases calling on her to resign as Speaker of the House of Representatives
When Parliament resumes on August 10, Mrs Bishop faces a motion of no confidence from Labor, Clive Palmer and Andrew Wilkie.
Labor's finance spokesman Tony Burke said Mrs Bishop's turnaround was not sincere.
"There's a difference between apologising because you are sorry and apologising weeks later to save your privileged job," he tweeted.
